meanings.definition: To carry in the womb during pregnancy.
meanings.sent1: The mother will gestate the baby for nine months before giving birth.
meanings.sent2: She gestated her child with care and love until it was time to deliver.
meanings.sent3: It's amazing how a woman can gestate a tiny human inside her body.
meanings.sent4: The idea began to gestate in her mind, slowly growing into a fully formed plan.
meanings.sent5: The seed of creativity gestated within her, ready to bloom into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To conceive and gradually develop in the mind.
meanings.sent1: He will gestate the project idea before presenting it to the team.
meanings.sent2: She gestated the concept for weeks before finally sharing it with her friends.
meanings.sent3: It's interesting to see how different people gestate new thoughts in their minds.
meanings.sent4: The solution to the problem began to gestate in his mind, becoming clearer with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The dream of success gestated within him, motivating him to work harder towards his goals.
